text:
Taking into account @PCManticore remarks concerning the preceding PR #452, all improvements concerning numpy are taken into account through the numpy brain module.
It consists essentially in introducing the signature of the numpy functions that are in `numpy.core.umath` and `numpy.random.mtrand` modules.
This way, not only pylint doesn't emit 'no-member' message anymore but it is also able to check function arguments.
title: Numpy brain refinement

text:

text: Hey @PCManticore, the CI passes but just because i added a decorator to skip the untittest concerning `numpy` if the `numpy` module is not present. Does it mean that those unittests are never executed in the CI (because tox env doesn't install numpy)?
@hippo91 apparently that's true! https://github.com/PyCQA/astroid/blob/7bfb5e83b162d2126c9929b6d863724176269b6d/tox.ini#L14 we weren't installing numpy for pypy and py3.3
Merged since the missing numpy doesn't block this PR. We'll handle this in its own change.
If you wrote this yourself and it doesn't contain code from other files, feel free to just add yourself here!
title: (2, '', u'astroid/tests/unittest_brain_numpy.py')
